storyInfo: The Rhodes Island group follows the trail of the Blood of Teekaz and makes their way to a Confessarius altar set up on the battlefield. However, they find themselves intercepted by Salus, and a number of strange creatures.

attributes.content: Sixty-five hours into the operation...
The battle between the ducal alliance and the Nachzehrers is brutal.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Just farther ahead is Silverrock Bluffs. The Originium response is intense, and the vehicle has already been paralyzed.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Vina should be arriving at the front lines soon.;The Exemplars have a tough task ahead of them.

attributes.content: When the Sighs of Kings and the Stone of the Sword become one, we'll be able to see it from our position.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: 'Catastrophes be sundered'.

attributes.content: It's only a myth.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: When people see things that defy explanation, they tend to exaggerate and romanticize them when passing down those to generations.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: The Sighs of Kings and The Shard–;The Victorians' 'shield' and 'spear'.
The Shard is an application of Originium on the same level as large-scale witchcraft devices.
And the Sighs of Kings is able to neutralize certain Originium reactions.

attributes.content: I see you've done your homework.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Originium is often likened to a 'chronic disease'.;To this day, the people of Terra's best solution to Catastrophes has been – and still is – to avoid them.
It is incredibly difficult for people to directly intervene in the mechanisms of Originium.;But, the Victorians have long mastered these tools to save themselves.
The origin of the Sighs of Kings lies not in Victoria, right?

attributes.content: The first time I saw the Sighs of Kings was deep within the palace of the Shahanshah in Sargon.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: People regard it as a symbol of the Aslan's royal authority and believe that it can protect any settlement or city. This is indeed true. It is able to neutralize Originium reactions to a certain extent.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Only to a certain extent?;You don't seem particularly concerned about that caveat.

attributes.content: That's right. No matter how much effort the Sargonian casters put into unearthing and retrofitting it, it was nothing but a former city defense device.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: During the era in which it was put to use, Originium was not yet widely-available across the continent.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I trust that it will be able to temporarily put a stop to Amnannam and give the Feranmut's spine an opportunity to take off, but it is not an inhibitor that can completely seal Originium activity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Have you been disappointed too many times over all these years?

attributes.content: Doctor... from your current perspective, what do you think Originium is?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A phenomenon brimming with the unknown? A resource to exploit? Or, perhaps, a source of disaster and disease?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: ...;I can't say.

attributes.content: You don't want to, because your answer would be 'all of the above'.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Originium has long been inextricably woven into everything we see – our environment, our technology, our culture, and even our bodies.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If a portion of a limb is necrotic, cutting it off might solve the problem. But, what if the problem stretches from beginning to end?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: There are some people who see you as omnipotent.
Why are you... looking at me?

attributes.content: Doctor, you asked me if I've ever experienced disappointment.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Just once.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I allowed myself to become overly dependent on one person, made a series of poor judgments, and paid the price.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Are you referring to...?;...;(Sigh)

attributes.content: But, it doesn't mean that I'll stop believing.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It is difficult enough to rebel against the very foundations of our origins. To pin your hopes on just one technology... or one person, is utterly unrealistic.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor! Dr. Kal'tsit! Please take a look at this!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: There's a cave up ahead.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Someone's concealed the entrance.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Crude, twisted. One of the Confessarius illusions.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I'm sure we'll find a witchcraft altar at its deepest point.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We should go to where the Originium response is the strongest.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: There's Originium everywhere.;This level of Originium activation is unprecedented.
How are you feeling, Amiya?;Logos, you're also an Infected. Do you feel anything abnormal?;Kal'tsit, will our medicine still work?

attributes.content: No problem here, Doctor.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We have more important things to do right now. I can tough it out.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I'd be lying if I said that these environmental conditions weren't affecting me at all.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But, it's more than just Originium.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: It beats being completely unprepared.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Under the influence of Amnannam, Originium will come closer to its true nature.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The crystal clusters will merge with all things – living and dead – at an increasing rate, sealing that data inside in an assimilated form.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Originium can only store information within its own structure. As such, any assimilated individuals will completely lose the forms they had in life.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Some may see this as nothing more than instantaneous 'decomposition'.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Just like those who die due to an Oripathy outbreak...

attributes.content: There are some parallels. In the case of these patients, after their consciousness disperses, their bodies will disintegrate into highly-activated Originium dust over a period of time.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Assimilation, on the other hand, condenses this entire process to the extreme.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Rhodes Island's technology can only delay cell-Originium assimilation rate from reaching a certain threshold. We are not able to truly erect a barrier that can stave off Originium.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Don't worry too much about that, Doctor. The Originium saturation rate in our current environment is far from an extreme level.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Is our situation not extreme enough still?;It's hard for me not to worry.

attributes.content: Right now, we can still breathe and move about.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If we're quick enough to stop the Originium from spreading further, all hope is not yet lost.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit, Doctor, I can hear enemy movements.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Logos, please prepare to intercept the enemy.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Intruders?!
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard
Confessarius Guard
attributes.content: It's the Banshee and––

attributes.name: Confessarius Guard
attributes.content: Urgh!
There are quite a few guards, but they're not difficult to manage.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: There must be greater dangers yet lurking in the shadows. Doctor, please stay close to us.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The interference of Confessarius witchcraft is making it hard for me to pinpoint the exact location – but the Blood of Teekaz is undoubtedly nearby.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Teekaz blood roused the first Originium from its slumber.
Over the millennia, the fate of the Sarkaz has been tangled together with Originium.
Amiya and Logos are suffering. Or rather, they've shouldered this pain the entire time just to come this far.
What about you, then? You think of all the times Kal'tsit had to suppress the words she wished to say.
You are not only a witness and a bystander. Surely, you share a deeper connection – with Originium, with this war, and with everything that's been going on.
This is...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: The Blood of Teekaz.

attributes.content: Duq'arael's obsession.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This so-called pure blood is free of 'impurities'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: By itself, it possesses no inherent power.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Amiya, cut off its connection to the altar.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Got it–
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Dr. Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Mon3tr, attack the corpse of that guard over there!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Howls)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: There's another Mon3tr?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No, there's more than just one – all those defeated Confessarius guards... weren't real guards at all!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Near-perfect replicas.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Only he could decorate this cave... to look nearly identical to a real altar.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This was a trap designed to lure us in.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.options: Damazti.

attributes.content: Amiya, get behind me!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Furious howl)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Mon3tr stands in front of you.
And you grip Amiya's hand tightly.
The Blood of Teekaz is collapsing along with the entire altar, the surrounding rock walls pressing ever closer.
The illusion is no more, but the shifting terrain is real.
The real altar must still be functioning. Originium continues to grow, and it will soon consume everything you see.
Doctor!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: This is...;...the Confessarii's den.

attributes.content: We seem to have fallen to the deepest level of the false altar.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Originium was shifting too fast, and I only had time to grab onto you.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I don't know where Dr. Kal'tsit and Logos are... There's too much Originium here, too much information. I can't sense them at all.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: They're probably far away by now.
The enemy wanted to entrap us.;They want to stop us from destroying the altar.
But, you might still be the Confessarii's real target.

attributes.content: What they want is the King of Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The ground is still shaking... Are the crystal clusters still spreading?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Wait, that's...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: A monster suddenly crawls forth from the Originium's depths.
The horns of a Wendigo. The body of a Gargoyle. The flames of a Diαblo.
You have seen these before, in the Confessarii's stone sculptures, of the various Sarkaz tribes.
But never before sharing the same body.
His emotions... are chaotic.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I see only memories – fragmented, blurry, and mashed together...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Amiya, over there!

attributes.content: There will be many more, Doctor.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: This is the cave that gave birth to them.
attributes.name: Amiya
Amiya
attributes.content: The Confessarii sculpted them from Sarkaz blood and Originium...

attributes.name: Amiya
attributes.content: And gave birth to these creatures.

attributes.options: Does this... make you sad?;Amiya...

attributes.content: They're alive, Doctor.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: They aren't chunks of rock, or constructs of witchcraft. They are living beings.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But, they obey only the call of the Confessarius. They do not feel any pain, nor do they cry for their fate.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: People would normally call these creatures... 'monsters'.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: That's right. Monsters.
Or alternatively... 'Chimeras'.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: Who are you even mourning for?
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: For these mindless kin, or for yourself – the Chimera forced to wear a crown?
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: (Roars)
attributes.name: Confessarius 'Chimera'

attributes.content: The fight is about to begin.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Amiya, are you being affected in any way?;Damn, more Confessarius witchcraft!

attributes.content: Doctor, I won't let the Confessarii trap me a second time.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I'm not so fragile as to let these illusions and nightmares get to me. That name, 'Chimera', is no different from those dream-interrogations. I've heard it many times before.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I have no right to be here, if I let myself get shaken by that.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Beyond that, however... I swore that I'd never let my immaturity drag you down again.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: A tiny crown appears above the head of the Cautus girl.
Black lines interweave and take form between her fingers.

attributes.options: Your connection with the King is deepening.

attributes.content: Perhaps...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But, it might not be enough.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: ...Amiya.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Don't be in such a hurry to leave.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: These clones are nothing before my incantations, Damazti.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Or, as you once put it, 'it is time wasted'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: We remember. That performance, and that stroll.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: We talked for quite some time.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: That day you at least still considered yourself a lord of the Royal Court, despite having a different appearance.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: What are you now?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: We try to take on different identities.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: But, these varying journeys have yet to provide us with an answer.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: What we conclude is, the path has neither beginning nor end. It is a cycle.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: And you sought out death to prove it.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: At death's end, is nothingness.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: The myriad souls you speak of have said nothing to us.
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: Banshee, how did it feel to sound the bone whistle for us?
attributes.name: Confessarius Guard?

attributes.content: 'Shatter'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: There's no end to them.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This is all you can muster? You've lost a lot of bite after your first death.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The clone, destroyed by the incantation, does not dissipate into nothingness as before.
Instead, that body simply collapses, sinking into the Originium tides until it quickly disappears without a trace.
From it, a hand resembling a withered branch extends from within the crystal cluster.
'Sudaram'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Banshee... You once killed me as well.
attributes.name: 'Sudaram'?

attributes.content: On the battlefield, I am not one of you.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: In Kazdel, I was ordered to kill those who betrayed the Royal Court.
attributes.name: 'Sudaram'?

attributes.content: You got in my way, and separated my head from my shoulders with your incantations.
attributes.name: 'Sudaram'?

attributes.content: You were but a child then, with a puerile voice.
attributes.name: 'Sudaram'?

attributes.content: ...I remember you.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The traitors you mentioned were a family of three who wanted to flee Kazdel in search of a peaceful life.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: They swore an oath of fealty to the Royal Court.
attributes.name: 'Sudaram'?

attributes.content: The Royal Court should never be held above ordinary Sarkaz. You may have been a war hero of Kazdel once, but I cannot allow you to slaughter civilians.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: So, you chose Babel, and Theresa... all for the sake of your so-called 'ordinary Sarkaz'.
attributes.name: 'Sudaram'?

attributes.content: That is the righteous path to the future.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But even after she died, you still didn't return to Kazdel!
attributes.name: Babel Member?

attributes.content: You even helped those outsiders steal away the King of Sarkaz!
attributes.name: Babel Member?

attributes.content: The inheritance of the King of Sarkaz was a decision made by Her Highness Theresa.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: You killed me with your own hands.
attributes.name: Babel Member?

attributes.content: When your incantations were coiling around my heart, strangling it... Haha, I couldn't believe it.
attributes.name: Babel Member?

attributes.content: After fighting alongside each other for so many years, whatever you felt towards me paled in comparison to those outsiders.
attributes.name: Babel Member?

attributes.content: The potted goldengrass you left behind on the ship is growing well now.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: After Her Highness's death, how many comrades did you slay with your own hands during the internal strife that engulfed Babel?
attributes.name: Babel Member?

attributes.content: The belongings left behind by so many people... I'm sure there's enough of 'em to fill your whole room, huh? Do you feel sorrow every time you look at that patch of grass I planted in that pot on a whim?
attributes.name: Babel Member?

attributes.content: If I were to feel sorrow...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: It would be because even death has denied you the solace you deserve.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Damazti, you were never so keen to dress yourself up as the 'dead' before.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This exchange of words cannot provide you with any answers, nor can probing my emotions.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The dead do not respond.
They continue to emerge from the dark crystal clusters.
Many faces, some familiar, others not. All of them Sarkaz.
Your innate abilities are resonating with the information stored inside the Originium.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Seeing as how your powers have grown thanks to the Originium–
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Logos raises one hand.
No incantations are needed – just a low humming sound from the vibrating of the rock walls.
In a heartbeat, all of the Damazti's clones are shattered.
Just as expected.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: There's one left... the very last one.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: It's you.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The Vampire stands there in the cave's depths, his expression almost identical to when he stood atop the Feranmut's skull that day.
However, it is no longer fresh blood that roils around him as before, but rather clusters of Originium crystal.
Logos can feel the blood in his body stirring.
The Sanguinarch of Vampires... Duq'arael.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: You're not like the others. I know this.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: You are not one of the Damazti's avatars.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Lord Damazti, this portion of you decided to assist Qui'sartuštaj.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No... We have no interest in helping anyone in particular. We are simply... searching for answers.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, we have met you before. When the Sarkaz were not yet Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: You walked across us.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: I have no recollection of any such meeting.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: At that time, we were unable to speak.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: And then...
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: The first King of Teekaz came in contact with Originium.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That was our first 'awakening'.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: The first individual rose up from among us.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: We felt one another.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: We had existed for an unknown amount of time before that. But, it was only at that moment when we became aware of our existence.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Because we began to 'think'.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Originium will assimilate all lifeforms it comes into contact with.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Not just you. But also the original Vampires, Banshees, and Wendigos... All Teekaz have changed. You are approaching the form of another entity that once existed on this land.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then, what are you?
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: (Howls agitatedly)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: It seems extremely averse to seeing another self.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: Kal'tsit... the Immortal.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: Do you still remember what you looked like at first?
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: The 'Immortal' is a figment of certain people's imaginations, and a misrepresentation of my self.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Time leaves its marks upon me all the same. The original entity by the name of 'Kal'tsit' has long been lost beneath the golden sands.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But, you are still yourself.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: We were watching as you were reborn at Theresa's side.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: You are different from your previous self, from your appearance to your personality.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: We are used to constant change for the sake of survival.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: Among the Sarkaz, the Damazti Cluster is unique. We once thought that you were like us.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: We know many 'Kal'tsit', just as Kal'tsit knows many of us.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: However, we will always be a whole. Each Damazti is a receptor for us to feel this land.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: But, 'Kal'tsit' is different. Each Kal'tsit is still you.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: I do believe that to be true.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: Is it the inheritance of memory that makes you so persistent? Memory can be easily tampered with and implanted. This, we know, for many long-lived beings have tried such methods.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: Such 'immortality' is nothing but an empty lie.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then, is it some kind of duty...
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: I won't deny that my life has been duty-bound from the moment I was born.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Looking back, I don't think... I've ever truly been 'alive'.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The substances that make up your body have all been replaced. The memories inherited from your previous self are unreliable. The mission imposed upon you may not even be your own.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, what is it that has kept the continuity of you across these thousands of years?
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: A name.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A unique name, or a title? It is a question that so many emotionally deprived Sarkaz would be keenly interested in.
attributes.name: Mon3tr?

attributes.content: This name, has many meanings.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The person who gave me this name, and the people I care about, are now in danger. This isn't the time for us to be having this chat.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We did not expect you to be this sentimental.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Mon3tr.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Excited howl)
attributes.name: Mon3tr
